RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 5 1/2F Turf CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIFE'S AN AUDIBLE coaxed from the gate, chased four then three wide down the backstretch, tucked to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive rallying to the front seventy yards from the finish and inched clear to the wire to prevail. TAMMY LYNN coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, ran on willingly through to the finish to secure the place honors. LUZ DIVINA broke out at the start bumping SEVEN NATTY PATTY just prior to Z TRAIN doing so, chased just off the inside down the backstretch and then three to four wide through the turn under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, went nine wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly to secure the show honors. ECHO BAYBE (IRE) prompted the pace from the two path coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, shied in being shown the crop to the right side near the eighth pole, then weakened in the late stages. Z TRAIN (IRE) broke in at the start bumping SEVEN NATTY PATTY just after LUZ DIVINA did, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, went eight wide into upper stretch, offered up a belated bid but was outkicked. BARAYE coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside under pressure from ECHO BAYBE to the outside through swift splits, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive clinging to command until overhauled seventy yards from home and weakened in the late going. SEVEN NATTY PATTY got bumped at the start by LUZ DIVINA and then Z TRAIN, chased three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, went seven wide into upper stretch and weakened. HOUSEFLY (IRE) chased three wide coaxed along from the five-sixteenths, continued three wide at the head of the stretch, offered no response. LYRICAL PARDON coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside under a ride from the five-sixteenths, cornered just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. SUGAR N SPICE four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing five-sixteenths from home, tipped out six wide at the top of the stretch, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Lyrical Pardon
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased inside, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Tammy Lynn
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, angled 5w upper, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Baraye
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, set down 2w 1/4, caught final 70yds

ENTRY.NAME: Echo Baybe (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Ellis Kenneth L Legion Racing Flash Toga Farm and Englehart Jeremiah C
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 2p, coaxed near 1/4, 3w upper, shied in, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Luz Divina
ENTRY.OWNER: Hamm Timothy E and Stud TNT
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2p, coaxed 3-4w 5/16, 9w upper, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Natty Patty
ENTRY.OWNER: Baccari Racing Stable LLC and Dream Walkin Farms Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped 2x st, chased 3w, coaxed 5/16, 7w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Z Train (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased 3-2w, coax 3/8, angled 8w uppr, bid, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Life's an Audible
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3-4w pursuit, 2p turn,6w uppr, up fin 70yds, inched cl

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 104. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).

CLAIM.OWNER: Two B and One C Stable

RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACCRETIVE went three wide on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside of the leader, turned up the pressure in the three path on the far turn, was asked inside the five-sixteenths, took the lead in the five path into upper stretch, came under a left-handed crop while battling outside of the runner-up outside the furlong marker, was given one final pop of the crop outside the sixteenth-pole then proved best while put to a strong-hand ride to the finish. UNCLE MOONLIGHT was hustled to the front, showed the way on the inside, passed the half-mile pole under urging, vied in the two path on the far turn, lost the lead into upper stretch, drifted out while fighting with the winner then came under a left-handed crop outside the eighth-pole, battled on well in the final furlong but missed while well clear for the place. TONAL IMPACT was off a step slow then hustled, saved ground on the first turn, moved off the rail early on the backstretch, settled inside of a rival under some urging, advanced closer late on the backstretch, came under stronger encouragement in the three path on the far turn, swung six wide into the stretch, remained on his inside lead until inside the furlong marker then swapped to the proper lead when thrown in the the rider and just got up for the show while no threat to the top two. MYSTIC NIGHT dropped back in the two path on the first turn, settled off the pace, moved closer late on the backstretch, was urged five wide on the far turn and lacked the needed response then just missed the show. RAM broke out while hustled, went around the opening bend in the two path, steadied outside the seven-eighths pole, settled off the pace, was urged along in the two path on the far turn, spun three wide into the stretch and failed to rally. GUNTOWN was hustled from the gate, went four wide on the first turn, chased the leader on the outside, was put to stronger urging while four wide on the far turn and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Ram
ENTRY.OWNER: Baker Christina and Mack William L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Flower Bowl S. - Grade2 SARATOGA RACE 3 1 3/8M Inner turf CR: 106. Stakes Purse 500000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PARNAC (FR) coaxed from the gate, briefly knocked heads in hand to the midway point on the first turn with TAMARAMA until that rival eased off, showed the way along the inside under a rating hold patiently handled through sensible splits uncontested and settled into a comfortable rhythm, got given a notch to work with at the three-eighths and began to slip away before her trio of rivals could get busy in behind, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, got let out straightened away for home and edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in holding well to the finish to score. MCKULICK (GB) just off the inside through the first turn, tracked along the hedge past the stands the initial time under a firm hold, tipped back to the two path through the clubhouse turn and stacked up in behind TAMARAMA using her as cover down the backstretch, had that rival tucked inside into the far turn and came under coaxing in the clear at the five-sixteenths, swung four to five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive offering up a kick to bid mildly on the leader inside the final sixteenth while along for the place honors. AMAZING GRACE (GER) settled at the tail of the compact field just off the inside using the cover of the aforementioned foe, remained patiently handled until placed to coaxing at the five-sixteenths, got set down spinning five to six wide into upper stretch, offered up a belated bid to miss for the place honors. TAMARAMA (GB) coaxed from the gate, knocked heads in hand just off the inside early on to the midway point on the first turn with PARNAC before easing off that rival to track just off the inside in closest aim, remained patiently handled and tucked inside through the far turn, got let out angled two to three wide at the top of the stretch, ran on through to the finish but was out-finished in the final sixteenth.

ENTRY.NAME: Parnac (FR)
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds and Dream With Me Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, rated ins, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, edged away, held well

ENTRY.NAME: McKulick (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p firm hold, coaxed 5/16, 4-5w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Tamarama (GB)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of ASC

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, tracked 2p, let out 2-3w upper, ran on, out-finished

ENTRY.NAME: Amazing Grace (GER)
ENTRY.COMMENT: firm hold at rear 2p, set down 5-6w upper, belated bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 104. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUDWIG showed good speed, disputed the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch, battled gamely with multiple opponents in the drive and narrowly prevailed while out-nodding the runner-up at the wire. FRAT PACK brushed with a rival at the start, was well placed towards the front, came under increased encouragement in the two path on the turn, was driven three wide into the stretch, chased the leading trio into the final furlong, gained to make a bid in the final sixteenth, fought on even terms to the last jump and was denied while losing the head-bob at the wire. BOURBON BASH settled off the pace, was asked while moving from three to five wide on the turn, rallied outside to make a bid in upper stretch, battled on even terms for the lead into the final sixteenth, fought determinedly to the finish and just missed while narrowly able to get the show. CHILENO broke out and brushed with a rival, was urged along off the pace, went three then four wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch, chased outside into the final furlong, gained fast into the final sixteenth and closed with a rush to just miss. AWESOME NATIVE was urged along on the inside of a rival, went two then three wide on the turn, was driven five wide into the stretch, gained into the final furlong, lacked room behind horses into the final sixteenth then paused while altering in and missed the superfecta. DAUFUSKIE ISLAND was hustled from the gate, contested the pace, vied inside on the turn, was asked for his best in upper stretch, battled under a drive into the final sixteenth then was out-kicked. LAFITTE'S FLEET was ridden along towards the back, went around the turn in the two path, came out some into upper stretch and lacked the needed response. CAPE TRAFALGAR was well placed just off the pace, chased inside on the turn and came up empty. BAYTOWN BEAR tracked the pace on the outside, was asked four wide on the turn, chased into the final furlong and tired. OCEAN'S RESERVE had the reins break at the start, had the rider do his best to stay board while lacking much control and was eased then walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Lafitte's Fleet
ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R Speranza Steven and GRC Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: ridden along,2path turn,came out into upper,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Daufuskie Island
ENTRY.OWNER: Scuderi Vincent S Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Cotrone Robert

ENTRY.NAME: Cape Trafalgar
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, inside turn, came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Chileno
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,brshd,urged along,3-4w turn,6w into lane,chsd,closed fast

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: LNJ Foxwoods, SB Racing Corp.,Anglo-American Thoroughbreds

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean's Reserve
ENTRY.COMMENT: reins broke start, no control by rider, eased, walked off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Prioress S. - Grade2 SARATOGA RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 101. Stakes Purse 250000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. This is a Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $250 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,250 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,250 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,250 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of two Graded sweepstakes allowed 2 lbs.; of one such race allowed 4 lbs.; of a sweepstake or two races other than maiden, claiming or starter allow ed 6 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey. Closed Saturday, August 19, 2023 with 15 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALVA STARR broke on top, then vied early on with a pair down the backstretch advancing to take sole command half a mile from home, shook away to a safe lead tucking to the two path through the turn, took the inside route into upper stretch under coaxing, got flashed the crop to the right side through to the eighth pole when roused, then went clear under a drive and was geared down in the final strides to the finish, the outcome in no doubt. JERSEY PEARL coaxed from the gate, vied inside a pair early on along the inside until shaken off half a mile from home, chased along the fence through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, cut the corner into upper stretch, tipped out to the two path straightened away, proved no match for the top one while running on clear for the place honors. DAZZLING BLUE broke out at the start, chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide into the turn and advanced on the leader latching on near the five-sixteenths, swung two then three wide straightened away into upper stretch, weakened in the final furlong while well clear of the rest for the show honors. UNSUNG MELODY chased three to four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch and tired. UNIFIED ALLIANCE hustled from the start, vied from the two path early on between foes, got shaken off into the turn and came under coaxing three furlongs from home, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Pearl
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, vied ins early, chased ins turn, cut corner, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Unified Alliance
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, vied 2p betw early, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Alva Starr
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied early 3p, shook away 2p turn, ins 1/4, went clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Brett A. Brinkman & P. Dale Ladner

ENTRY.NAME: Dazzling Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 5w backstretch, advanced 3w turn, 2-3w upper, wknd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. INNER TURF (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AGATE ROAD shied outward at the start while last to commence, went four wide on the first turn, settled towards the rear on the outside, was roused in the three path on the far turn, swung seven wide into the stretch, shied out while inside of a bumping skirmish outside the eighth-pole, rallied outside into the final furlong and closed fast to get up late. STOLEN MAGIC went around the first turn in the three path, stalked the pace on the outside, engaged the leader in the two path on the far turn, spun three wide into the stretch, held a short advantage into the final furlong, fought gamely to the finish and was denied while just able to get the place. TOM COLLINS was taken under tight restraint early then rated inside under a snug hold, drafted along the hedge on the far turn, was asked at the quarter-pole, altered out behind the leaders outside the furlong marker, chased those foes then altered out again near the sixteenth-pole, swapped back to his inside lead at that juncture, gained late and just missed between foes on the line while just able to get the show. OCALA ROCKET went to the front, went around the first turn in the two path, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside on the far turn, was asked near the quarter-pole then spun into the stretch in the two path, dueled with the runner-up into the final sixteenth, fought on determinedly to the finish and just missed. VIN SANTO went two to three wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was roused three wide on the far turn, swung six wide into the stretch, was bumped by a rival outside the furlong marker, came in significantly under a right-handed crop nearing the sixteenth-pole, had the riders right-hand slip off the rein while trying to correct, slammed into a foe causing several horses to have trouble, was taken up while corrected and lost momentum. ZVEREV was unsettled in the gate then broke towards the rear, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled on the outside, went four then three wide on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch, darted in behind a bumping skirmish inside the furlong marker, paused inside another bumping incident near the sixteenth-pole and finished with good energy. BUFFOON (FR) veered in at the start, settled on the inside, was asked in the two path at the quarter-pole, chased into the final furlong, was bumped near the sixteenth-then steadied and missed the minor awards. DANGEROUS DRIVER moved in early, settled on the inside, was roused on the far turn, stayed inside in the stretch and lacked the needed response. WALLEY WORLD was bumped at the start and forced in, saved ground on the first turn, settled off the pace, was roused while moving from the two path to the four path on the far turn then driven five wide into the stretch, came out outside the furlong marker then bumped soundly with a foe, was bumped very hard at the sixteenth-pole then checked while clipping heels and dropped out. GET READY TO ROCK was taken in hand early, traveled around the first turn in the three path, was reserved off the pace, went three wide under urging on the far turn, spun four wide into the stretch, chased under a drive into the final furlong, was bumped hard between foes at the sixteenth-pole and checked then also dropped out. FOLLOWING A STEWARDS' INQUIRY INTO THE STRETCH RUN, VIN SANTO WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM FIFTH AND PLACED LAST FOR INTERFERENCE NEAR THE SIXTEENTH-POLE

ENTRY.NAME: Walley World
ENTRY.OWNER: LaPenta Robert V e Five Racing Thoroughbreds and Madaket Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Tom Collins
ENTRY.OWNER: Janney, III, Stuart S. and Phipps Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold,hard held ins,rated,altered out twice stretch,gained

ENTRY.NAME: Get Ready to Rock
ENTRY.OWNER: America's Pastime Stables Bouchey Steven Red Diamond Stable Nedlaw Stable and Sl

ENTRY.NAME: Zverev
ENTRY.OWNER: Belladonna Racing LLC Peachtree Stable Twin Brook Stables and West Point Thoroug
ENTRY.COMMENT: unsettled gate,2p1st,at rear,4-3p2nd,darted in ins1/8,good energy

ENTRY.NAME: Agate Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable and St Elias Stables LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GENERAL PARTNER got bumped at the start by SHAMROCK SHAKE, who broke outwards awkwardly, raced forwardly placed just off the inside early on under coaxing and took over command six furlongs out, showed the way tucking inside nearing the turn, remained inside through the bend coming under coaxing near the quarter pole under growing threat from a pair, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and straightened away to the rail under a right handed crop, surged clear to the eighth pole, the rider switching the crop to the left side at that station, then drifted out slightly while holding clear to the finish. DIVE BOMBER coaxed from the gate, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while along well clear of the rest and second best. JEFFERSON STREET chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole before being set down cornering three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive weakening in the late stages while along best of the rest. ENLIGHTEN got away to a tangled start when reacting to the kicking action of the assistant starter and came inwards bumping JUST BE HAPPY, chased three to four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung five wide into upper stretch and weakened. ASK ISAAC got away to an awkward start when shying from the kicking motion of the assistant starter, chased three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and tired. SHAMROCK SHAKE broke awkwardly when lunging a bit shying from the assistant starters kick, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into upper stretch and tired. RIVETAGE chased along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into upper stretch, made no impact. TYPHOON FURY chased just off the inside just off the pace, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and tired. JUST BE HAPPY got bumped at the start by ENLIGHTEN, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung three wide for home, made no impact. JUSTIFIABLY SO chased four wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, went six wide into upper stretch, and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Ask Isaac
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, 5-6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Shamrock Shake
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, chased ins, coaxed 5/16, cut corner, tired

ENTRY.NAME: General Partner
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, up 3/4p, 2p early, ins turn, 2w 1/4p, surged clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Kenneth L. Ramsey & Sarah K. Ramsey & Speightstown Syndica

ENTRY.NAME: Rivetage
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Diamond Racing LLC and Baker Stephen R
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 5/16, cut corner, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Just Be Happy
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 7/16, 3w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Enlighten
ENTRY.COMMENT: tangled st, chased 3-4w, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Typhoon Fury
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable and R A Hill Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Dive Bomber
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Jefferson Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w backstretch, 3w turn, set down 3w upper, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Harvey Pack S. SARATOGA RACE 8 5 1/2F Turf CR: 109. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. Fo r horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4%t o fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake other than State-bred in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or S tate-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. Starters to be named at the closing time of entries. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the main track. Closed Saturdayy,
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THIN WHITE DUKE brushed with a rival at the start, settled at the rear, moved out near the nine-sixteenths, was roused while moving from three to five wide on the turn, rallied outside under a right-handed crop while remaining on his inside lead in upper stretch, swapped to the proper lead just before being switched to a left-handed crop while closing well outside the sixteenth-pole and got up to prevail. BIG INVASION brushed with a rival at the start, was taken in hand early then rated just off the pace, drafted inside to the two path on the turn, was asked into upper stretch then split horses to make a bid at the three-sixteenths, led under a drive from the eighth-pole to near the sixteenth-pole, fought on with the winner to the finish and was denied while just able to get the place. OUR SHOT stalked the pace on the outside, went two then three wide on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, battled outside of two foes under a drive into the final furlong, fought on well to the finish and just missed while clear for the show. DANCING BUCK was hustled to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole then came under a drive into upper stretch, lost the lead inside the three-sixteenths, fought inside of two foes into the final furlong and weakened. CHESS MASTER tracked the pace on the outside, went three then four wide on the turn, was roused into upper stretch and lacked the needed kick. MISTER MMMMM was pulled up on the backstretch then moved out towards the outside fence, galloped around the turn under restraint and was grabbed by an outrider in upper stretch then vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Dancing Buck
ENTRY.OWNER: J and N Stables and Diamond M Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Thin White Duke
ENTRY.OWNER: Gleaves Philip A Crist Steven deRegt Ken and Hilliard Bryan

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of ASC

ENTRY.NAME: Our Shot
ENTRY.OWNER: Gatsas Stables Schoenfeld Steven and Terranova II John P

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 9 6F Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Purse 95000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISSING FORTUNE chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, tipped out to the six or seven path nearing the eighth pole and rallied to issue a challenge and take command just inside the sixteenth marker, then edged away to the finish to prevail. MAJESTIC RETURN broke out at the start bumping BIG BEAN CHRISTINE, chased three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive to prevail in the battle of attrition up front seizing command nearing the sixteenth pole, then got overhauled inside that station and dug in to hold over a pair of rivals for the place honors. EASY PLAY chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled out seven wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly to just get up for the show honors on the wire. ATHENA BEACH broke out at the start and was corrected before making contact with a rival, chased two then three wide coming under coaxing half a mile from home, angled four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive offering up a mild bid and angled in seventy yards from the finish moving around MAJESTIC RETURN and missed for the place and show honors in the final jump. BIG BEAN CHRISTINE bumped at the start by MAJESTIC RETURN, who broke outwards, chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch and improved position to the end. FANCY FELINE took the overland route chasing six to seven wide down the backstretch and through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, cornered six wide into upper stretch and passed tired rivals. SANDY'S GARDEN dueled inside of RICHIES PRINCESS soon after the start and came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths when shaken off briefly a bit, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened in the final furlong. FORCES SWEETHEART chased along the inside and then just off the inside under coaxing from three furlongs out, swung four wide into upper stretch, offered no response. RICHIES PRINCESS dueled from the two path coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and was collared inside the eighth pole, then weakened through to the finish. ROBYN AND ELI chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch and made no impact. MERAVIGLIOSO chased three then two wide coming under coaxing midway on the turn, cornered just off the inside into upper stretch, made no impact. TOSCONOVA BEAUTY chased four to five wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, angled six wide at the head of the stretch, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Robyn and Eli
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 3/8, angled 4-5w upper, no impact

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 2p 3/8, angled 4w upper, no response

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 2p 3/8, angled 7w upper, belatedly

ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 1/2, 4w uppr, angled in, mild bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 1M Inner turf CR: 102. Allowance Purse 149500. INNER TURF (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 1 24 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DRAKON was hustled from the gate, raced in the three path on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, was asked in the two path on the far turn, made a bid while three wide into upper stretch, dueled outside of the runner-up to the finish and gamely prevailed under strong urging. FREDO went to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked near the quarter-pole, dueled inside of the winner in the stretch, fought determinedly to the finish and just missed while clear for the place. I'M VERY BUSY was taken under restraint early, raced inside to the two path on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, saved ground on the far turn, was roused into upper stretch, pursued the top two in the final furlong and willingly earned the show. RUSE stumbled at the start but regained footing quickly and broke towards the front, settled in a good position on the inside, drafted along the hedge on the far turn, swung four wide into the stretch, chased the dueling leaders into the final furlong and weakened. ROYAL SPIRIT was rank under restraint into the first turn, saved ground while reserved off the pace, was asked inside the five-sixteenths, hugged the hedge in the stretch and lacked the needed response. SO HIGH (GB) rounded the first turn in the three path, was rated outside under a tight hold, went three wide while asked on the far turn, spun five wide into the stretch and came up empty. BAD TO THE BONES was reserved towards the rear, saved ground on the turns, was asked for his best in upper stretch and failed to rally. DANZIGWITHTHESTARS bumped with a rival at the start, traveled around the first turn in the two path, was reserved on the outside, went three wide on the far turn, swung six wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. LANDBISCUIT went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was roused four wide on the far turn, spun five wide into the stretch and also failed to respond. TALLAHATCHIEBRIDGE bumped with a rival at the start, raced three wide on the first turn, was reserved on the outside near the back, came under urging in the two path on the far turn, spun four wide into the stretch and also lacked the needed response. INTERNAL CAPITAL was rank under tight restraint in the two to three path on the first turn then reserved off the pace, traveled around the far turn in the three path, came under a drive in upper stretch and also failed to respond. HEATHGUARD hit the outside of the gate hard at the break, dropped well behind early, raced inside to the two path on the turns and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Very Busy
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Hanley Schermerhorn Richard and Braverman Paul

ENTRY.NAME: Drakon
ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables and Acqua Nova Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Jockey Club Gold Cup S. - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 11 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 114. Stakes Purse 1000000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRIGHT FUTURE broke out a step at the start, raced forwardly placed tucking to the two path into the first turn, tracked the leader in closest aim while just off the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, advanced and took over command before swinging three wide into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under lone threat to the outside drifting out two paths to the sixteenth marker before being corrected, then came out two paths in the late stages to look his main danger in the eye under an active left rein and just held on at the wire. PROXY brushed the off side stall at the start and came under brief coaxing, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, tipped out a path straightened away, dug in under a drive and got on track nearing the final sixteenth rallying to latch on the leader with seventy yards to go and just missed at the finish by a nod of the nostrils. TYSON got bumped solidly at the start off stride by DUKE OF LOVE breaking inwards, raced three wide through the first turn before chasing three to four wide down the backstretch, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, ran on to secure the show honors. CLAPTON coaxed from the start, raced three wide through the opening bend, chased three to four wide down the backstretch before heading four to five wide through the far turn coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, went seven wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. DUKE OF LOVE broke in at the start bumping TYSON solidly off stride, chased four wide throughout under coaxing from the three-eighths, went six wide into upper stretch and made no headway through to the finish. RATTLE N ROLL just off the inside through the first turn, chased three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and came up empty. WARRIOR JOHNY established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside, came under coaxing midway on the far turn under challenge, yielded the front nearing the quarter pole and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, then weakened through to the finish. UNBRIDLED BOMBER coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside under encouragement from the seven-sixteenths marker, took the inside route into upper stretch and tired. Please note the opening quarter mile split was hand-timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Proxy
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, dug in, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Unbridled Bomber
ENTRY.OWNER: Potash Edward C Yankanich Brad and Ryerson James T
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 7/16, inside 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior Johny
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, coaxed 3/8, yielded near 1/4, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Rattle N Roll
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p 1st turn, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Clapton
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3w 1st turn, chased 3-4w, 4-5w 3/8, 7w uppr, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Tyson
ENTRY.OWNER: Hill 'n' Dale Equine Holdings Inc (J G Sikura) and Stretch Run Ventures LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped solidly st, 3w 1st turn, 3w pursuit, 5w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Duke of Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, 4w 1st trn, chased 4w, coaxed 3/8, 6w uppr, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Bright Future
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable and St Elias Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out step st, tracked 2p, coaxed 3/8, up 3w uppr, just held on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 12 1 1/16M Turf CR: 72. Maiden Claiming Purse 50000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwi se Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DREAM ROAD bobbled after the start then was hustled before being taken under a tight hold early, saved ground on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, went two then three wide on the far turn, rallied to make a bid at the furlong marker, took a short lead outside the sixteenth-pole and prevailed under strong urging. JANNIE MAE went to the front, rounded the first turn in the two path, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside on the far turn, was asked late on that bend, came under the crop in upper stretch, led into the final furlong, was headed by the winner outside the sixteenth-pole, fought with that foe to the finish and missed while able to get the place. PINSTRIPEPIZZO was pinched back between horses after the start, saved ground on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, moved from the rail to the two path on the far turn, shifted four wide into the stretch and finished willingly for the show. DUNEEN BAY went four wide on the first turn, settled towards the rear, was roused two then three wide on the far turn, swung six wide into the stretch and improved position. OUTTA THE CLOUD traveled around the first turn in the three path, tracked the pace on the outside, was asked in the two path on the far turn, chased under a drive into the final furlong and tired. LEM ME DRINK smashed hard through the front of the gate at the start then got loose but was grabbed by the starter, was brought back around then deemed fit to run by the state veterinarian, raced under right restraint behind horses into the first turn then clipped heels, went three wide on that bend, was unhurried near the back, saved ground on the far turn, moved off the rail under the crop in upper stretch and failed to rally. MISS BARB broke out and was off a step slow, traveled around the first turn in the two path, moved out near the back around the five-eighths pole, went four wide on the far turn and failed to threaten. JAYLA veered out at the start, had LEM ME DRINK clip her heels into the first turn, went four wide on that bend, settled on the outside without cover, was roused three then four wide on the far turn, spun five wide into the stretch and came up empty. SPERSS tossed her head into the first turn, saved ground while off the pace, was roused on the far turn and failed to respond. KNOCKZCATOFFZFENCE was taken under a tight hold early, went three to four wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, was asked while moving from three to five wide on the far turn and also failed to respond. CAMCHA navigated the first turn in the two path, settled in the middle of the field, dropped back while moving from the two path to the four path on the final turn, was taken in hand outside the quarter-pole and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Pinstripepizzo
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched back after brk,ins-2path turns,4w1/4,willingly for show

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Barb
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Road Racing Mazman Racing Thomas Sally and Payne Olga
